page.title: 18LOCAL ISSUES JULY 1985
page.content: There are two local free newspapers which are delivered to nearly every home in the area.They are the Wirral Globe and the Hoylake and West Kirby edition of The Wirral News. The summary of local issues covers the week ending July 12th 1985. There were rumours this week that untreated sewage was to be pumped into the sea off North Wirral and as this would have affected our area there were strong protests.These rumours were denied by the North West Water Authority. There have been fears expressed by members of the locality about the increasing numbers of burglaries in the district. There is general concern amongst many people about the poor condition of some of the roads and pavements in the area.
